content.title: Banglashree for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises: State Capital Investment Subsidy (CIS)
content.department: Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and Textiles
content.details: The scheme 'State Capital Investment Subsidy' is a sub-scheme under the 'Banglashree for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises' scheme. It was launched on 1st April 2020 and shall remain in force till 31st March 2025. The objective is to extend fiscal incentives to encourage entrepreneurs to set up MSMEs, focusing on balanced development and creating a sustainable ecosystem.
benefits: Micro Enterprise: 25% for Zone C; 40% for Zone D; 60% for Zone E.
Small Enterprise: 15% for Zone C; 30% for Zone D; 40% for Zone E.
Additional subsidy of 20% for enterprises wholly owned by women, SC/ST, and minority community entrepreneurs.
eligibility: The business/organization should be a Micro/ Small/ Medium Enterprise.
The business/organization should belong to the manufacturing sector.
The business/organization should have started production on or after 1st April 2019.

The business/organization should be in the private sector/ cooperative sector/ joint sector undertaking or should be a company/ undertaking owned and managed by the State Government or the Industrial SHGs.
The Date of Commencement of Commercial Production (DOCCP) should be between 1st April 2020 to 31st March 2025.
exclusions: Enterprises registered and for which eligibility certificates have been issued /incentives have been sanctioned and/or disbursed under the respective Incentive Scheme of the State.
Negative List of Industries includes Sponge Iron Factory, Bricks (excluding Fly Ash bricks, Sand lime Bricks, Refractory Bricks), and any other industry notified by the State Govt.
content.application_process: Online. Visit the Shilpasathi Portal and follow the registration and application steps as outlined.
documents_required: Copy of the Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association authenticated by the Registrar of Companies/partnership deed.
A statement on the name and address of the Directors / Partners / Owners of the enterprise.
A copy of loan sanctions letter and disbursement letter issued by financial institutions/banks.
A copy of the audited balance sheet for the last 2 years.
List of plants and machinery with original value, along with copies of the bills.
Copy of the land deed (wherever applicable).
Copy of valid consent to operate certificate from the WBPCB.
Copy of acknowledgement of Udyog Aadhaar Registration.

faqs.question: What areas are classified under Zone A for the purpose of determining incentives?
faqs.answer: Zone A includes the Kolkata Municipal Corporation Area, all municipal areas of North 24-Parganas, all municipal areas of South 24-Parganas, and all municipal corporation and municipal areas of Howrah.

faqs.question: What is the State Capital Investment Subsidy available for micro and small enterprises in different zones?
faqs.answer: Micro enterprises in Zone C receive 25%, in Zone D they receive 40%, and in Zone E they receive 60%. For small enterprises, the subsidy in Zone C is 15%, in Zone D it's 30%, and in Zone E it's 40%.

faqs.question: Are there any additional subsidies available for certain categories of enterprises?
faqs.answer: Yes, micro and small enterprises wholly owned by women, SC/ST, and minority entrepreneurs are eligible for an additional subsidy of 20%.
